intro: Wycliffea rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf wycliffea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with two lips. The leaves are typically round or ovate, and the plant often grows in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in rocky or clay soils and is adapted to subtropical climates. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological preferences.
